alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 2:43PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Davidson and northwestern Williamson Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 242 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairview, or 11 miles northwest of Franklin. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fairview, Leipers Fork and Natchez Trace At Highway 96. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 182 and 184. Interstate 840 between mile markers 7 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
